abstract: Report by National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine finds most recent generations of immigrants are settling into American society as rapidly and broadly as earlier ones; report examined 41 million foreign-born residents, including about 11.3 million illegal immigrants, along with roughly 37 million children born to them in country.
lead_paragraph: The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine says immigrants are eager to learn English and are not burdening the health care system.

headline.main: Newest Immigrants Assimilating as Fast as Previous Ones, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Immigrants Fitting In to U.S., Report Says

snippet: The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine says immigrants are eager to learn English and are not burdening the health care system.

keywords.value: National Academies of the United States
keywords.name: organizations
